column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0013] Embodiments of the invention relate to a device and method that employ photo-induced charge separation and an electrical sensor detecting the charge separation.

#Text=In the embodiments, the photo-induced charge separation is a reflection of specific chemical and/or biological interactions and is detected by the electrical sensors, which can be part of an integrated on-chip device for performing chemical analysis and medical diagnostics.

#Text=In specific embodiments, the electrical sensor is a field effect transistor that detects photo-induced charge separations occur in materials involved in specific chemical or biological interactions.
#Text=[0014] The embodiments of the invention further relate to a device and method where an array of electrical sensors and corresponding molecular complexes are contained in a single substrate.
#Text=Signals from the electrical sensor are detected and collected by circuitries on the substrate or in a separate device.
#Text=One application of the electrical sensor array of the invention is their use in a protein or DNA array for simultaneous multiple protein or DNA analysis.

#Text=The substrate of the embodiments of the invention may be part of an integrated device that also serves as a microarray or macroarray, an integrated circuit, a microfluidic device, a MEMS, or a combination.
#Text=Therefore, samples contained or processed by the device may be also analyzed by the integrated device and the signals processed for analysis.
#Text=[0015] A biological sample often contains many thousands or even more types of biomolecules and clinical diagnosis needs to measure multiple analytes for disease confirmation.
#Text=Currently, each analyte is measured separately, which requires multiple samples from a patient.
#Text=The procedure is time consuming and labor intensive.
#Text=Multiplex assays, in which multiple analytes can be measured at the same time, have been developed to solve this problem.
#Text=However, in conventional multiplex assays, the detection of different types of labels, such as nanoparticles, are not effective due to signal strength and sensitivity.
#Text=[0016] Current photo detection devices are usually large in size and are difficult to be included in an integrated device.
#Text=On the other hand, field effect transistors have the advantage of being small in size and easily integratable into a single device.
#Text=But, due to problems related to signal intensity and sensitivity, FETs have drawbacks in serving as electrical sensors.

#Text=Embodiments of the present invention combine the principles of photo-induced charge separation and field effect transistors as electrical sensors and achieve detection of analytes, especially bioanalytes, that is more specific and sensitive.
#Text=[0017] In the embodiments of the invention, analytes that can be detected include antigens of all types, such as proteins, polysaccharides, and small molecules coupled to a protein.
#Text=The specific bindings between antigens and their corresponding antibodies form the basis of immunoassays.
#Text=Antibodies suitable for the embodiments of the invention include monoclonal antibodies, polyclonal antibodies, recombinant antibodies, random peptides and aptamers.
#Text=Immunoassays suitable for the embodiments of the invention include solid-phase immunoassays based the sandwich principle and the competing principle.
#Text=Also included are specific types of immunoassays such as enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and electrochemiluminescence (ECL).
